intro: Ridsdalea attopevensis, commonly known as the Attopevenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Ridsdalea attopevensis is a rare and endangered species, with a limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
